pages.text: Helium is the second element on the periodic table, and has an atomic mass of 2. Helium is a gas at normal room temperature and pressure. As it is a gas, you will not be able to hold this gas for long with your bare hands, so you will have to use a closed test tube or jar to store this gas.
As this gas is lighter than all other gases, you can only hold it for extremely short amounts of time, before it will just rise up and exit the atmosphere.

pages.title: Obtainability
pages.text: There is one main way in which you can obtain helium, and that is through helium gas pockets which have been left there from decayed thorium-232 and uranium-238.
